item.title: Galaxy S25 series ‘secret’ AI features, price in India leaked ahead of January 22 Samsung Unpacked - The Financial Express
item.description:
Galaxy S25 Series Features and Pricing Leaked Ahead of Unpacked Event

Publication Date: January 20, 2025

Source: Financial Express

Samsung is set to unveil its Galaxy S25 series on January 22, 2025, and leaks have revealed details about its features and pricing in India.

  • Upcoming models include Galaxy S25, S25+, and S25 Ultra.
  • Features AI enhancements like Google Gemini for smart suggestions.
  • New “Morning Brief” feature aggregates daily important information for users.
  • Pricing in India expected to increase, with the S25 starting at Rs 84,999.
  • Improved video capabilities with “Nightography” and an Audio Eraser feature.
“The Galaxy S25 series will come with cutting-edge features, powered by the new Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.”

The Galaxy S25 series is shaping up to be a significant upgrade over its predecessor, combining enhanced performance with innovative AI features.

item.title: Jewellery brand Indriya plans 100 stores, open to lab grown diamonds pivot - Business Standard
item.description:
Jewellery brand Indriya plans 100 stores, open to lab grown diamonds pivot

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Business Standard

Indriya, a jewellery brand from Aditya Birla Group, aims to open 100 new stores in the next 18 months to enhance its presence in the organised jewellery market. CEO Sandeep Kohli stated the company is ready to pivot towards lab grown diamonds if consumer interest grows.

  • Indriya currently has 12 stores across major cities in India and plans to reach 14 by the end of the month.
  • The organised jewellery retail market is valued at Rs 6-7 trillion in India.
  • The brand launched with an investment of Rs 5,000 crore last July.
  • Indriya aims to utilize a franchise model for its expansion.
  • The company reports better-than-expected performance in footfall and sales across its stores.
“Being new, we are quite agile and don’t have any baggage of the past. So, it’s very easy for us to pivot into whichever segments the consumer likes,” - Sandeep Kohli, CEO

Indriya is striving to become a top player in the jewellery segment, competing with established names like Tanishq and Reliance Jewels.

item.title: Indriya open to lab-grown diamond pivot; firm plans to launch 100 stores - Business Standard
item.description:
Indriya Plans to Open 100 Stores and Explore Lab-Grown Diamonds

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Business Standard

Indriya, the jewellery brand under the Aditya Birla Group, aims to expand its footprint by opening 100 new stores within the next 18 months while considering the potential for lab-grown diamonds.

  • Indriya currently has 12 stores, with plans to increase to 14 by month-end.
  • CEO Sandeep Kohli highlighted the company's readiness to pivot towards lab-grown diamonds if consumer interest grows.
  • The organised jewellery retail market in India is valued at between Rs 6-7 trillion.
  • Indriya is utilizing a franchise model for its expansion efforts.
  • The brand has seen strong performance metrics, with sales exceeding expectations during the festival season.
“We want to be a large-scale jewellery player and be among the top two or three players in the segment,” said Sandeep Kohli.

Indriya seeks to establish itself in a competitive market dominated by brands like Tanishq and Reliance Jewels.

item.title: Elon Musk Offers $6,000+ Salaries for Walking 8 Hours a Day, but Can You Meet Tesla’s Tough Demands? - The Daily Galaxy --Great Discoveries Channel
item.description:
Elon Musk Offers $6,000+ Salaries for Walking 8 Hours a Day, but Can You Meet Tesla’s Tough Demands?

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Tesla News

Tesla is offering a unique job opportunity tied to its Optimus humanoid robot project, with salaries exceeding $6,000 per month for physically demanding tasks aimed at training the robot’s capabilities.

  • The role is centered around creating the physical intelligence of the Optimus robot.
  • Candidates will need to use VR headsets and motion sensor suits to perform various physical actions.
  • The position has specific height, flexibility, and technical adaptability requirements.
  • There are challenges associated with extended virtual reality exposure, including potential virtual reality sickness.
  • Optimus robots are already operational in Tesla's Fremont factory, showcasing their functionality.
  • Musk believes that humanoid robots will reshape labor markets.
  • The project hints at a future where robotics and humans work collaboratively in various sectors.
"This role is not just lucrative—it’s transformative. Participants are contributing to technology that could redefine industries."

The Optimus project signals a pivotal shift for Tesla towards an automated society, raising questions about employment and the future of human-robot interaction.

item.title: Flipkart Republic Day Sale ends in 2 days: Prices of iPhone 16 and more to increase - India Today
item.description:
Flipkart Republic Day Sale ends in 2 days: Prices of iPhone 16 and more to increase

Published On: Jan 17, 2025
Source: India Today

The Flipkart Republic Day sale, celebrating India's 76th Republic Day, offers significant discounts on various smartphones, including the iPhone 16. This sale will end on January 19, after which prices will revert to original launch rates.

  • Discounts on popular phones like iPhone 16, iPhone 13, Moto G85 and OnePlus 12.
  • Prices of smartphones will start to sell at their original prices as the sale ends.
  • iPhone 16 discounted to Rs 69,999, down from Rs 79,999.
  • iPhone 16 Plus available for Rs 79,999; iPhone 16 Pro at Rs 1,12,900.
  • Samsung Galaxy S24's price reduced to Rs 57,398.
  • Mid-range smartphones like Motorola Moto Edge 50 Pro on sale for Rs 27,999.
“Flipkart is giving a total discount of Rs 9,901 for the Plus version.”

This sale represents a last opportunity for consumers to make significant savings on popular smartphone models before prices rise.

item.title: OnePlus 13 Review: This Smartphone Is the Total Package - PetaPixel
item.description:
OnePlus 13 Review: A Complete Smartphone Experience

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: PetaPixel

The OnePlus 13 emerges as a strong contender in the flagship smartphone arena, building on its predecessor's strengths while introducing enhancements in design, performance, and camera capabilities.

  • Introduces MagSafe compatibility for convenient accessory options.
  • Features Snapdragon 8 Elite processor with up to 24GB of RAM and 1TB storage.
  • Impressive 6000mAh battery capable of fast charging in 36 minutes.
  • Consistent camera improvements with a new telephoto and ultra-wide lens.
  • Incorporates advanced AI editing tools and improved software capabilities.
  • OxygenOS 15 provides a refined user experience.
“The OnePlus 13 feels like a total package.”

In conclusion, the OnePlus 13 stands out in a competitive market, offering an attractive blend of features, a strong camera performance, and excellent battery life, making it a worthwhile purchase for those seeking a new flagship device.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra, Galaxy S25+ and Galaxy S25 Price in India Leaked Ahead of Galaxy Unpacked - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Here's How Much the Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Might Cost in India

Publication Date: January 18, 2023 | Source: Gadgets 360

The Samsung Galaxy S25 series is set to debut at the Galaxy Unpacked event on January 22, 2023. Recent leaks suggest a price increase over the previous Galaxy S24 series.

  • The base model Galaxy S25 may be priced at Rs. 84,999 for 12GB RAM and 256GB storage.
  • Galaxy S25+ could start at Rs. 1,04,999 for 12GB RAM and 256GB storage.
  • Galaxy S25 Ultra may be priced at Rs. 1,34,999 for the base 12GB+256GB model.
  • Expected price increases are attributed to the adoption of the new Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.
“The slight price increase reflects the latest technology and market trends.”

As anticipation builds for the Galaxy Unpacked event, Samsung continues to accept reservations for the new S series smartphones, indicating strong market interest.

item.title: Can a computer learn to speak trader? | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Can a computer learn to speak trader?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Mint

As artificial intelligence continues to evolve, compliance software companies are attempting to interpret the complex language of traders in order to combat financial crimes.

  • Microsoft and Google translate languages, but financial jargon remains a challenge.
  • AI is increasingly being used by compliance firms to decode trader communication.
  • Wall Street and London regulators are investigating the potential for AI tools to assist with financial crime prevention.
"Up-and-coming compliance software firms are leaning into artificial intelligence to help crack esoteric trader argot."

The integration of AI into the finance sector could potentially enhance regulatory oversight and the fight against financial misconduct.

item.title: Microsoft shows how Gen AI can aid material discovery with MatterGen AI model - The Indian Express
item.description:
Microsoft shows how Gen AI can aid material discovery with MatterGen AI model

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Indian Express

Microsoft Research has unveiled MatterGen, an AI model that revolutionizes the discovery of new materials, significantly improving the speed and efficiency of material creation.

  • MatterGen utilizes a diffusion architecture to generate new materials across the periodic table.
  • It produces stable materials twice as effectively as previous methods.
  • The model can tailor materials based on specific properties like strength or weight.
  • Breakthroughs include generating magnets without rare Earth elements.
  • This technology promises advancements in various sectors, including technology and energy.
“If AI models like MatterGen can design materials faster, they can improve technology substantially.”

This innovation marks a significant step forward in material science, holding the potential to address issues such as resource scarcity and environmental pollution.

item.title: Samsung Teases New Way To Interact With Mobile Through Hologram Experience Ahead of Galaxy Unpacked 2025 - Samsung Global Newsroom
item.description:
Samsung Teases New Way To Interact With Mobile Through Hologram Experience Ahead of Galaxy Unpacked 2025

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Samsung News

Samsung Electronics has unveiled an immersive hologram experience in London, showcasing its innovative mobile AI features ahead of the Galaxy Unpacked event on January 22.

  • The hologram showcase features projections that represent user memories, including marine life, sports highlights, and more.
  • Displayed images hint at the new intuitive experiences expected from Galaxy AI and the upcoming Galaxy S series.
  • Large-format visuals were projected 100 feet above the ground, creating a captivating urban installation.
  • On-site social media engagement has boosted global anticipation for the Galaxy Unpacked event.
“This activation marks a breakthrough in the next chapter of Galaxy AI mobile experiences.”

The holographic projections provide a glimpse into the future of mobile interaction, promising a more engaging experience for users worldwide.

item.title: Samsung Teases New Way To Interact With Mobile Through Hologram Experience Ahead of Galaxy Unpacked 2025 - Samsung
item.description:
Samsung Teases New Way To Interact With Mobile Through Hologram Experience Ahead of Galaxy Unpacked 2025

Publication Date: January 15 | Source: Samsung Electronics

Samsung Electronics unveiled a groundbreaking holographic experience in London, showcasing the future of mobile AI ahead of the Galaxy Unpacked event scheduled for January 22.

  • The showcase featured immersive holographic projections paired with voice interactions.
  • Displayed images included marine life, exotic plants, and sports highlights, symbolizing memories captured by mobile devices.
  • The large-scale projection was positioned 100 feet above ground, creating a visually stunning display.
  • This event sets anticipation for the new features in the upcoming Galaxy S series lineup.
"Samsung invites viewers from around the world to tune into Galaxy Unpacked on January 22."

The event not only highlighted Samsung's innovative technology but also amplified expectations for what is to come in the Galaxy mobile experience.

item.title: OnePlus 13 vs iQOO 13: Is spending ₹15,000 extra justified? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
OnePlus 13 vs iQOO 13: Is spending ₹15,000 extra justified?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Hindustan Times

This article compares the OnePlus 13 and iQOO 13, two flagship smartphones priced under ₹70,000, aiming to evaluate whether the higher cost of the OnePlus 13 is justified.

  • Both devices utilize Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.
  • The OnePlus 13 can have up to 1TB of storage and 24GB of RAM; the iQOO 13 is limited to 512GB and 16GB respectively.
  • The OnePlus 13 supports both wired and wireless charging; the iQOO 13 has faster wired charging but no wireless option.
  • Camera quality favors OnePlus 13 due to Hasselblad tuning, while both have triple-camera setups.
  • Software updates: OnePlus promises four years of OS updates and six years of security, while iQOO guarantees four OS upgrades and five years of security patches.
  • Pricing: OnePlus 13 at ₹69,999 vs iQOO 13 at ₹54,999, a difference of ₹15,000.
“If you prioritize camera performance, the OnePlus 13 is the clear winner. However, for value and gaming, the iQOO 13 is hard to beat.”

In conclusion, while the OnePlus 13 offers superior camera and build quality, the iQOO 13 presents a compelling value proposition for budget-conscious consumers.

item.title: Noise launches Tag 1 object tracker compatible with Android, iOS: Details - Business Standard
item.description:
Noise launches Tag 1 object tracker compatible with Android, iOS: Details

Last Updated: Jan 17 2025 | 5:12 PM IST | Source: Business Standard

Indian electronics brand Noise has launched its first object tracker, the Noise Tag 1, which is compatible with both Android and iOS devices.

  • The Noise Tag 1 is priced at Rs 1,499 and will be available starting January 28.
  • It integrates with Google’s Find My Device and Apple’s Find My Network for locating lost items.
  • Features include Ring Mode, Lost Mode, and Network Mode, which aid in finding misplaced items.
  • The device has a replaceable battery that lasts up to one year and is rated IPX4 for water resistance.
“Noise Tag 1 offers various modes for locating lost items, ensuring users can find their valuables with ease.”

This launch marks a significant step for Noise into the smart tracking market, positioning them alongside competitors like Reliance Jio.

item.title: How to use Microsoft’s AI PowerPoint generator to create presentations for you | Mint - Mint
item.description:
How to Use Microsoft’s AI PowerPoint Generator for Quick Presentations

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

The Microsoft 365 Copilot service enables users to quickly create presentations using generative AI. By providing basic information and ideas, users can generate complete presentations, including designs and text.

Step-by-Step Guide to Create AI Presentations

  1. Open PowerPoint online or the desktop app and select Copilot.
  2. Choose to create a presentation based on a reference or describe the desired content.
  3. Enter a detailed prompt in Copilot specifying the presentation requirements.
  4. Review and edit the generated presentation as needed.

Key Features of AI Presentations

Users can receive content recommendations, writing assistance, and design help, making the presentation creation process efficient.

item.title: FRENCH DESIGNER LOUIS-GABRIEL NOUCHI TAKES THE PUMA MOSTRO TO RADICAL NEW TERRITORY - About PUMA
item.description:
FRENCH DESIGNER LOUIS-GABRIEL NOUCHI TAKES THE PUMA MOSTRO TO RADICAL NEW TERRITORY

Date & Source: Not specified

Nouchi transforms the iconic Puma Mostro with a modern slip-on design suitable for the future.

This innovative collaboration merges design and comfort, inspired by the essence of the Puma.

  • The Mostro is updated for 2025 with a backless, slip-on fit.
  • Two colorways: tonal white and black.
  • Available from January 23 through LGN, with retail options starting January 25.
“I synthesized the essence of the iconic Mostro shoes into a radical mule design using a single material,” said Nouchi.

This design aims to redefine comfort and style in sneaker fashion.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S26 Series Tipped to Use Silicon-Carbon Batteries - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S26 Series Tipped to Use Silicon-Carbon Batteries

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Gadgets360

The upcoming Samsung Galaxy S26 series is speculated to feature silicon-carbon batteries, enhancing energy density and environmental sustainability. This follows the expected launch of the Galaxy S25 series on January 22.

  • Samsung Galaxy S25 series will unveil models on January 22, including base, Plus, and Ultra variants.
  • The Galaxy S26 series is rumored to use different types of batteries, specifically silicon-carbon.
  • Silicon-carbon batteries are expected to be more environmentally friendly and safer than current lithium-ion cells.
  • The Galaxy S26 may include Exynos chips, with the Ultra model possibly incorporating Qualcomm's Snapdragon processor.
  • Samsung plans to modernize their nomenclature, possibly replacing Plus and Ultra with Pro and Note.
"Silicon-carbon batteries are expected to increase the energy density of batteries by more than 10 percent."

The shift to silicon-carbon technology highlights Samsung's commitment to innovation and sustainability within its mobile lineup.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Tipped to Bring Gemini Integration With Samsung Apps, AI-Powered Now Brief Feat... - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Series to Feature Gemini AI Integration

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Gadgets 360

The upcoming Samsung Galaxy S25 series, set to be unveiled on January 22, is rumored to include new AI features, particularly the integration of Gemini AI with Samsung's first-party apps, enabling enhanced functionalities.

  • Integration of Gemini AI with apps like Calendar, Notes, and Reminder.
  • New Now Brief feature providing daily summaries styled within cards.
  • Gemini can perform complex tasks, like extracting information from YouTube videos for notes.
  • Uncertainty exists regarding whether these features will be included at launch.
“Hey Gemini” command will allow users to trigger the assistant for task execution.

The anticipated features reflect Samsung's ongoing push for AI advancements, but details remain unconfirmed until the official launch.

item.title: Apple hits pause on AI notification summaries for news in iOS 18.3 after accuracy complaints - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Apple hits pause on AI notification summaries for news in iOS 18.3 after accuracy complaints

Date: Jan 17, 2025
Source: CNBC TV18

Apple has temporarily disabled its AI-driven news notification summaries in iOS 18.3 after receiving complaints about inaccuracies from sources like BBC News. The tech giant plans to refine the feature for a future update.

  • Apple's iOS 18.3 update includes changes to its Intelligence Notification Summaries feature.
  • Notifications for News and Entertainment apps have been temporarily disabled.
  • The move comes after complaints that summaries pulled inaccurate or misleading information.
  • Notification Summaries will still be available for non-news apps.
  • A warning in Settings now indicates the feature is still in beta.
  • Summarised text appears in italics for clearer differentiation.
“Apple acknowledged the issue and promised to refine the feature, with plans to bring back news summaries in a future update.”

This update highlights Apple's effort to address user concerns about misinformation in its notification summaries.

item.title: Realme 14 Pro+ review in 5 points: A mid-budget phone with flagship-like features - India Today
item.description:
Realme 14 Pro+ review in 5 points

Date: Jan 17, 2025 | Source: India Today

The Realme 14 Pro+ has launched in India at a starting price of Rs 29,999, boasting several premium features including a quad-curve display, a robust battery, and a unique design. Here’s a recap in 5 points.

  • Design: Unique colour-changing rear panel and compact form factor.
  • Display: 6.83-inch AMOLED display with 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Performance: Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 chipset with a 6000mAh battery.
  • Camera: Triple-camera setup with impressive photo quality.
  • Verdict: Compelling option with flagship features at a mid-budget price.
“The Realme 14 Pro+ is a compelling option worth considering in the price range.”

item.title: Vivo T3 Pro and Vivo T3 Ultra get official price cut in India: Check new pricing - India Today
item.description:
Vivo T3 Pro and Vivo T3 Ultra Get Official Price Cut in India

Published On: Jan 17, 2025

Source: Nandini Yadav

Vivo has officially announced a price cut for its T3 Pro and T3 Ultra smartphones, reducing prices shortly after their launches.

Revised Pricing

  • The Vivo T3 Pro is now priced at Rs 22,999 (down from Rs 24,999) for the 8GB RAM + 128GB variant.
  • The 8GB RAM + 256GB variant is now available for Rs 24,999 (down from Rs 26,999).
  • The Vivo T3 Ultra's price has been revised to Rs 29,999 (down from Rs 33,999).
  • Additional bank discounts are available for both models on select bank cards.

Specifications

Vivo T3 Pro:

  • 6.67-inch curved AMOLED display with 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Powered by Snapdragon 7 Gen 3 chipset.
  • 5,500mAh battery with 80W fast charging.
  • 50MP dual-camera setup and 16MP front camera.

Vivo T3 Ultra:

  • 6.78-inch 3D curved AMOLED display with 1.5K resolution.
  • Powered by MediaTek Dimensity 9200+ processor.
  • 5,500mAh battery with 80W fast charging.
  • 50MP dual-camera setup with AI-powered photo editing features.
